description.narrative: The project title is Gender Justice through active socio-cultural participation (GJSCP) for 2016-2020. The main focus of the project is to enhance active socio-cultural participation of adolescent girls, boys and village women. The project envisage that rights holders will work to protest injustice and inequality in their own lives and also will act for others especially on incidents of child marriage, dowry, domestic violence and sexual harassments for instance. The total Rights holders are 2,560 (60% female) from 20 villages and eight schools of two adjacent Upazilla’s of Chittagong. Chittagong especially Chandanaish and Anwara belt are more conservative areas in the question of socio-economic equality of women and men. People consists of different religious ethnicity e.g. Muslims, Buddhists and Hindus. Women from Hindu communities are also deprived of various rights mostly at family levels. Women’s equal rights and responsibilities are largely ignored, resulting from family pressure, religious pressure and the traditionally male dominated environment. Gender based violence (GBV) e.g. dowry, VAW in families is common. Civil society is not so much concerned human rights such as dowry system, early marriage and GBV. The river erosion, Natural disaster, flash flood are a common factors in working area due to the river Shankha and also the sea is not far from here. The major project results are gender equality and prevention of Gender Based Violence, Inproved SRHR issues, strengthened rights holders, strengthened Women and children’s community representation and participation, improved democratic culture and DRR issues. Major activities are forming and organizing different groups and forum like Organizing training, meeting and orientation on Gender and family law, SRHR, RTI act for different group. Provide legal aid, counselling and other support for victim.
This project mainly contributes to results within Combating gender based violence. Results will be reported later in the Global Civsam grant period 2016-2020
